intro: Brachystelma montanum, commonly known as the mountain ghost flower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and vibrant, short-lived flowers. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow, orange, and red, often blooming in the early morning. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
